Interface_name: Http based on libcurl in C++
Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a multi-threaded HTTP download manager using libcurl in C++ that can handle multiple download tasks concurrently, avoid duplicate downloads, and manage resources efficiently.

Class Description: The DownloadPool class manages a pool of worker threads that process download tasks. Each task downloads a file from a given URL and saves it to a specified output path. The class ensures thread safety and prevents duplicate downloads.

Attributes:
- m_threads: std::vector<std::thread> - Collection of worker threads
- m_queue: std::queue<Task> - Queue of pending download tasks
- m_urls: std::unordered_set<std::string> - Set of unique task identifiers to prevent duplicates
- m_mtx: std::mutex - Mutex for thread synchronization
- m_noMoreTask: bool - Flag indicating no more tasks will be added

Methods:
- DownloadPool() -> void - Constructor initializes libcurl and creates worker threads
- ~DownloadPool() -> void - Destructor cleans up libcurl resources
- addTask(const std::string& url, const std::string& output) -> void - Adds a new download task if not already present
- setNoMoreTask() -> void - Signals that no more tasks will be added
- finishAndWaitForExit() -> void - Waits for all threads to complete current tasks
- run() -> void - Worker thread function that processes tasks from the queue

Task Class Description: The Task class represents an individual download task with URL and output file path.

Attributes:
- m_url: std::string - URL to download from
- m_output: std::string - Local file path to save to

Methods:
- run() -> void - Executes the download task using libcurl
- writeData(void* buffer, size_t size, size_t nmemb) -> size_t - Callback function for writing received data to file
